definitions.definition: The first-person singular, as the object (of a verb, preposition, etc).

subdefinitions.definition: As the object (direct or indirect) of a verb.
Myself ; as a reflexive direct object of a verb.
Myself ; as a reflexive indirect object of a verb; the ethical dative .
As the object of a preposition.

definitions.definition: As the complement of the copula ( be ).
examples: Who said that? -(It was) not me .

definitions.definition: Used for the pronoun in isolation or in apposition.
examples: Who did this? — Me . I did it. (≈ It was me. I did it.)

definitions.definition: I , the first-person singular, as the subject.

subdefinitions.definition: As the subject of a verb.
examples: Me and my friends played a game.
[It was] literally all me and my astrophysicist colleagues could talk about.
Stella and me have opted to take a course called ‘Autobiography and Fiction’.
subdefinitions.label_groups: informal , with a conjunction , often proscribed

subdefinitions.definition: As the subject of a verb. Sometimes used to indicate or imitate limited English fluency.
Would be the subject of a copula in standard English, though the copula is omitted; used to indicate or imitate limited English fluency.

main_definition: The first-person singular, as the object (of a verb, preposition, etc).
secondary_definitions: ( sometimes proscribed ) As the complement of the copula ( be ).
Used for the pronoun in isolation or in apposition.
( nonstandard or proscribed ) I , the first-person singular, as the subject.
